column4: is there any s/ware available to listen to a .amr sound recording from my mobile on Ubuntu Karmic?
I have no idea! I have a nokia 'n it let me record a sound file 'n I blue toothed it onto my pc!
ic , so a sound file, try with vlc first
Thanks it's very busy installing stuff! ;)
it's a player apart from others in that way, it brings a bunch of own codecs, even exotic ones
U my hero of the day! :) Will it let me save it into somming windoze friendly?
first check if you can play it
vlc itself doesn't convert, but might give more usefull info about filetype
there are good converters, if not, can use audacity to re-record it and save as wav or other win-compatible, most can b converted (if playable at all)
woosh!! But thanks...may email it to a geek friend 'n let him sort it! Thanks gonna see if it works now. :)
if vlc plays it, are on it
